label: banding-controlled
definition: Alteration that selectively replaces specific bands within rocks.

label: layer-controlled
definition: Alteration restricted to compositionally or texturally defined layers within rocks.

label: bedding-controlled
definition: Alteration that selectively replaces specific beds within sedimentary rocks.

label: breccia vein
definition: Alteration associated with a fissure containing cemented wallrock fragments.

label: hydrothermal breccia-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially associated with a breccia.

label: fault breccia
definition: Alteration associated with a fault displaying angular rock fragments resulting from fracturing.

label: fault-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially associated with a fault.

label: foliation-controlled
definition: Alteration confined to volumes of rocks exhibiting a foliation.

label: structure-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially restricted to rocks within and/or immediately adjacent to structures such as shear zones, fault zones, veins, hydrothermal breccias, vugs or fractures.

label: pervasive
definition: Alteration characterized by the replacement of most, or all, original rock-forming minerals and obliteration of textures at the scale of observation.

label: selectively non-pervasive
definition: Alteration characterized by the replacement of only specific components (e.g. minerals, grains, clasts) of the original rock, with partial to complete obliteration of textures only in part of the area under observation.

label: selective
definition: Alteration characterized by the replacement of only specific components (e.g. minerals, grains, clasts) of the original rock, with partial to complete obliteration of textures at the scale of observation.

label: selectively pervasive
definition: Alteration characterized by the replacement of only specific components (e.g. minerals, grains, clasts) of the original rock, with partial to complete obliteration of textures across the whole area of observation.

label: shear zone-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially associated with a shear zone.

label: unaltered
definition: A rock with no visible signs of alteration, in which primary minerals, fabrics (including primary pore space) and chemistry are unchanged.

label: unconformity-related
definition: Alteration that occurs at or around an unconformable or disconformable contact.

label: vein-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially associated with a vein.

label: vug-controlled
definition: Alteration associated with small cavities in a vein or rock, usually lined with crystals of a different mineral composition from the enclosing rock.

label: zoned-central
definition: The central region of an alteration zone

label: zoned
definition: Alteration that can be divided spatially into several mineralogically or texturally distinct regions, with systematic variations in mineral assemblages, compositions and/or textures.

label: zoned-inner
definition: The inner region of an alteration zone.

label: zoned-outer
definition: The outer region of an alteration zone.

label: fracture-controlled
definition: Alteration spatially associated with a fracture, i.e. with any break/separation in a geological formation with or without relative displacement of the parts (e.g. a joint or a fault).

label: non-pervasive
definition: Alteration that has replaced or filled in only certain portions of the rock at the scale of observation (e.g. the envelopes around veins), certain primary minerals, or pore spaces (including vesicles and interclast voids).
